subject: Communication
title: Framing: How the Same Story Changes Meaning
description: A fast breakdown of Framing: How the Same Story Changes Meaning for builders.

hook.text: 'Tax relief' vs. 'tax cuts for the wealthy.' Same policy. Different frame. Different public reaction. That's framing.

buildup.text: Framing is selecting certain aspects of reality and making them more prominent to promote a particular interpretation.

discovery.text: Kahneman and Tversky showed that framing a surgery as '90% survival' vs.

twist.text: All media is framed. There's no 'view from nowhere.' The question isn't whether framing exists, but whose frame you're.

climax.text: Media-literate consumers don't just consume the frame. They identify it, consider alternatives, and ask who benefits.

punchline.text: Every story has a frame. See the frame, and you see the story differently.

quiz.question: What is media framing?
options: Selecting aspects of reality to promote a particular interpretation
